species.name: pikipek
descriptions: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.
It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!
It pecks at trees with its hard beak. You can get some idea of its mood or condition from the rhythm of its pecking.
This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth.

abilities.name: skill-link
abilities.effect: Extends two-to-five-hit moves and triple kick to their full length every time.

abilities.name: pickup
abilities.effect: Picks up other Pokémon's used and Flung held items.  May also pick up an item after battle.
